member.summary: Boolean indicating if we are between a call of Begin and End.

member.summary: The effect used for the current Begin/End session.

member.name: P:Xenko.Graphics.BatchBase`1.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the parameters applied on the SpriteBatch effect.

Begins a sprite batch rendering using the specified sorting mode and blend state, sampler, depth stencil, rasterizer state objects and a custom effect. Passing null for any of the state objects selects the default default state objects (BlendState.AlphaBlend, depthStencilState.None, RasterizerState.CullCounterClockwise, SamplerState.LinearClamp). Passing a null effect selects the default effect shader.
member.param: The effect to use for this begin/end draw session (default effect if null)
Sprite drawing order used for the Begin/End session.
Blending state used for the Begin/End session
Texture sampling used for the Begin/End session
Depth and stencil state used for the Begin/End session
Rasterization state used for the Begin/End session
The value of the stencil buffer to take as reference for the Begin/End session
member.exception: Only one SpriteBatch at a time can use SpriteSortMode.Immediate

member.name: M:Xenko.Graphics.BatchBase`1.End
member.summary: Flushes the sprite batch and restores the device state to how it was before Begin was called.

The offset in the vertex buffer where the vertex of the element starts

member.name: T:Xenko.Graphics.BatchBase`1.StaticQuadBufferInfo
member.summary: A class containing the information required to build a vertex and index buffer for simple quad based batching.
member.remarks: The index buffer is used in static mode and contains six indices for each quad. The vertex buffer contains 4 vertices for each quad. Rectangle is composed of two triangles as follow: v0 - - - v1 v0 - - - v1 | \ | | t1 / | If cycle=true: | \ t1 | If cycle=false: | / | | t2 \ | | / t2 | v3 - - - v2 v2 - - - v3

member.name: T:Xenko.Graphics.Blend
member.summary: Blend option. A blend option identifies the data source and an optional pre-blend operation.
member.remarks: Blend options are specified in a .

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.Zero
member.summary: The data source is the color black (0, 0, 0, 0). No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.One
member.summary: The data source is the color white (1, 1, 1, 1). No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.SourceColor
member.summary: The data source is color data (RGB) from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.InverseSourceColor
member.summary: The data source is color data (RGB) from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.SourceAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data (A) from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.InverseSourceAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data (A) from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.DestinationAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a rendertarget. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.InverseDestinationAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a rendertarget. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.DestinationColor
member.summary: The data source is color data from a rendertarget. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.InverseDestinationColor
member.summary: The data source is color data from a rendertarget. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.SourceAlphaSaturate
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation clamps the data to 1 or less.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.BlendFactor
member.summary: The data source is the blend factor set with . No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.InverseBlendFactor
member.summary: The data source is the blend factor set with . The pre-blend operation inverts the blend factor, generating 1 - blend_factor.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.SecondarySourceColor
member.summary: The data sources are both color data output by a pixel shader. There is no pre-blend operation. This options supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.InverseSecondarySourceColor
member.summary: The data sources are both color data output by a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB. This options supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.SecondarySourceAlpha
member.summary: The data sources are alpha data output by a pixel shader. There is no pre-blend operation. This options supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.Blend.InverseSecondarySourceAlpha
member.summary: The data sources are alpha data output by a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A. This options supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: T:Xenko.Graphics.BlendFunction
member.summary: RGB or alpha blending operation.
member.remarks: The runtime implements RGB blending and alpha blending separately. Therefore, blend state requires separate blend operations for RGB data and alpha data. These blend operations are specified in a .

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendFunction.Add
member.summary: Add source 1 and source 2.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendFunction.Subtract
member.summary: Subtract source 1 from source 2.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendFunction.ReverseSubtract
member.summary: Subtract source 2 from source 1.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendFunction.Min
member.summary: Find the minimum of source 1 and source 2.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendFunction.Max
member.summary: Find the maximum of source 1 and source 2.

member.summary: Set to true to enable independent blending in simultaneous render targets. If set to false, only the RenderTarget[0] members are used. RenderTarget[1..7] are ignored.

member.summary: An array of render-target-blend descriptions (see ); these correspond to the eight rendertargets that can be set to the output-merger stage at one time.

member.summary: Describes the blend state for a render target.

member.summary: Enable (or disable) blending.

member.summary: This specifies the second RGB data source and includes an optional pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStateRenderTargetDescription.ColorBlendFunction
member.summary: This defines how to combine the RGB data sources.

member.summary: This specifies the first alpha data source and includes an optional pre-blend operation. Blend options that end in _COLOR are not allowed.

member.summary: This specifies the second alpha data source and includes an optional pre-blend operation. Blend options that end in _COLOR are not allowed.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStateRenderTargetDescription.AlphaBlendFunction
member.summary: This defines how to combine the alpha data sources.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStateRenderTargetDescription.ColorWriteChannels
member.summary: A write mask.

member.name: T:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStates
member.summary: Known values for .

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStates.Default
member.summary: A built-in state object with settings for default blend, that is no blend at all.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStates.Additive
member.summary: A built-in state object with settings for additive blend, that is adding the destination data to the source data without using alpha.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStates.AlphaBlend
member.summary: A built-in state object with settings for alpha blend, that is blending the source and destination data using alpha.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStates.NonPremultiplied
member.summary: A built-in state object with settings for blending with non-premultipled alpha, that is blending source and destination data using alpha while assuming the color data contains no alpha information.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStates.Opaque
member.summary: A built-in state object with settings for opaque blend, that is overwriting the source with the destination data.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BlendStates.ColorDisabled
member.summary: A built-in state object with settings for no color rendering on target 0, that is only render to depth stencil buffer.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BufferPoolAllocationType.UsedOnce
member.summary: Notify the allocator that this buffer won't be reused for much more than 1 (or few) draw calls. In practice, on older D3D11 (not 11.1) and OpenGL ES 2.0 hardware, we won't use a dedicated cbuffer. This has no effect on new API where we can bind cbuffer offsets.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.BufferPoolAllocationType.UsedMultipleTime
member.summary: Notify the allocator that this buffer will be reused for many draw calls. In practice, on older D3D11 (not 11.1) and OpenGL ES 2.0 hardware, we will use a dedicated cbuffer. This has no effect on new API where we can bind cbuffer offsets.

member.summary: Gets the number of pixels in bitmap row.

summary.para: Gets the pitch's absolute value is the number of bytes taken by one bitmap row, including padding. However, the pitch is positive when the bitmap has a down flow, and negative when it has an up flow. In all cases, the pitch is an offset to add to a bitmap pointer in order to go down one row.
Note that padding means the alignment of a bitmap to a byte border, and FreeType functions normally align to the smallest possible integer value.
For the B/W rasterizer, pitch is always an even number.

member.summary: Resource is active and available for use.

member.summary: Resource is in a reduced state (partially or completely destroyed) because application is in the background. Context should still be alive. This is useful for freeing dynamic resources such as FBO, that could be easily restored when application is resumed.

member.summary: Resource has been destroyed due to graphics device being destroyed. It will need to be recreated or reloaded when rendering resume.

member.name: T:Xenko.Graphics.GraphicsResourceUsage
member.summary: Identifies expected resource use during rendering. The usage directly reflects whether a resource is accessible by the CPU and/or the GPU.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.GraphicsResourceUsage.Default
member.summary: A resource that requires read and write access by the GPU. This is likely to be the most common usage choice.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.GraphicsResourceUsage.Immutable
member.summary: A resource that can only be read by the GPU. It cannot be written by the GPU, and cannot be accessed at all by the CPU. This type of resource must be initialized when it is created, since it cannot be changed after creation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.GraphicsResourceUsage.Dynamic
member.summary: A resource that is accessible by both the GPU (read only) and the CPU (write only). A dynamic resource is a good choice for a resource that will be updated by the CPU at least once per frame. To update a dynamic resource, use a Map method.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.GraphicsResourceUsage.Staging
member.summary: A resource that supports data transfer (copy) from the GPU to the CPU.

member.name: T:Xenko.Graphics.PresentInterval
member.summary: Defines flags that describe the relationship between the adapter refresh rate and the rate at which Present operations are completed.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.PresentInterval.Immediate
member.summary: The runtime updates the window client area immediately, and might do so more than once during the adapter refresh period. Present operations might be affected immediately. This option is always available for both windowed and full-screen swap chains.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.PresentInterval.Default
member.summary: Equivalent to setting One.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.PresentInterval.One
member.summary: The driver waits for the vertical retrace period (the runtime will beam trace to prevent tearing). Present operations are not affected more frequently than the screen refresh rate; the runtime completes one Present operation per adapter refresh period, at most. This option is always available for both windowed and full-screen swap chains.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.PresentInterval.Two
member.summary: The driver waits for the vertical retrace period. Present operations are not affected more frequently than every second screen refresh.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.PrimitiveType.TriangleStrip

remarks.p: The following diagram shows a 3D box, where the origin is the left, front, top corner.

The values for right, bottom, and back are each one pixel past the end of the pixels that are included in the box region. That is, the values for left, top, and front are included in the box region while the values for right, bottom, and back are excluded from the box region. For example, for a box that is one pixel wide, (right - left) == 1; the box region includes the left pixel but not the right pixel.

dd.p: The x position of the left hand side of the box.
The y position of the top of the box.
The z position of the front of the box.
The x position of the right hand side of the box.
The y position of the bottom of the box.
The z position of the back of the box.

member.summary: Adds a sprite to a batch of sprites for rendering using the specified texture, destination rectangle, source rectangle, color, rotation, origin, effects and layer.
member.param: A rectangle that specifies (in screen coordinates) the destination for drawing the sprite. If this rectangle is not the same size as the source rectangle, the sprite will be scaled to fit.

The color to tint a sprite. Use Color.White for full color with no tinting.
Specifies the angle (in radians) to rotate the sprite about its center.

The depth of a layer. By default, 0 represents the front layer and 1 represents a back layer. Use SpriteSortMode if you want sprites to be sorted during drawing.

member.name: T:Xenko.Graphics.SpriteSortMode
member.summary: Defines sprite sort-rendering options.
member.remarks: Description is taken from original XNA SpriteBatch class.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.Deferred
member.summary: Sprites are not drawn until End is called. End will apply graphics device settings and draw all the sprites in one batch, in the same order calls to Draw were received. This mode allows Draw calls to two or more instances of SpriteBatch without introducing conflicting graphics device settings. SpriteBatch defaults to Deferred mode.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.Immediate
member.summary: Begin will apply new graphics device settings, and sprites will be drawn within each Draw call. In Immediate mode there can only be one active SpriteBatch instance without introducing conflicting device settings.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.Texture
member.summary: Same as Deferred mode, except sprites are sorted by texture prior to drawing. This can improve performance when drawing non-overlapping sprites of uniform depth.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.BackToFront
member.summary: Same as Deferred mode, except sprites are sorted by depth in back-to-front order prior to drawing. This procedure is recommended when drawing transparent sprites of varying depths.

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.SpriteSortMode.FrontToBack
member.summary: Same as Deferred mode, except sprites are sorted by depth in front-to-back order prior to drawing. This procedure is recommended when drawing opaque sprites of varying depths.

member.name: M:Xenko.Graphics.VertexElement.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,Xenko.Graphics.PixelFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

dd.p: The HLSL semantic associated with this element in a shader input-signature.
The HLSL semantic associated with this element in a shader input-signature.

The semantic index for the element. A semantic index modifies a semantic, with an integer index number. A semantic index is only needed in a case where there is more than one element with the same semantic. For example, a 4x4 matrix would have four components each with the semantic name
, however each of the four component would have different semantic indices (0, 1, 2, and 3).
The data type of the element data. See .
Optional. Offset (in bytes) between each element. Use D3D11_APPEND_ALIGNED_ELEMENT for convenience to define the current element directly after the previous one, including any packing if necessary.

member.name: M:Xenko.Graphics.VertexHelper.GenerateMultiTextureCoordinates``1(Xenko.Graphics.VertexDeclaration,``0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates multi texture coordinates for an existing vertex buffer. See remarks.
member.returns: A new vertex buffer with additional texture coordinates.
member.remarks: The original vertex buffer must contain at least a TEXCOORD[0-9] attribute in order for this method to work. This method will copy the value of the first existing TEXCOORD found in the vertex buffer to the newly created TEXCOORDS.

member.name: T:Xenko.Graphics.ViewType
member.summary: Defines how a view is selected from a resource.
member.remarks: This selection model is taken from Nuaj by Patapom (http://wiki.patapom.com/index.php/Nuaj)

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.ViewType.Full
member.summary: Gets a texture view for the whole texture for all mips/arrays dimensions.
member.example:
Here is what the view covers with whatever mipLevelIndex/arrayIndex
Array0 Array1 Array2 ______________________ Mip0 | X | X | X | |------+------+------| Mip1 | X | X | X | |------+------+------| Mip2 | X | X | X | ----------------------

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.ViewType.Single
member.summary: Gets a single texture view at the specified index in the mip hierarchy and in the array of textures The texture view contains a single texture element at the specified mip level and array index
member.example:
Here is what the view covers with mipLevelIndex=1 and mrrayIndex=1
Array0 Array1 Array2 ______________________ Mip0 | | | | |------+------+------| Mip1 | | X | | |------+------+------| Mip2 | | | | ----------------------

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.ViewType.ArrayBand
member.summary: Gets a band texture view at the specified index in the mip hierarchy and in the array of textures The texture view contains all the mip level texture elements from the specified mip level and array index
member.example:
Here is what the view covers with mipLevelIndex=1 and mrrayIndex=1
Array0 Array1 Array2 ______________________ Mip0 | | | | |------+------+------| Mip1 | | X | | |------+------+------| Mip2 | | X | | ----------------------

member.name: F:Xenko.Graphics.ViewType.MipBand
member.summary: Gets a band texture view at the specified index in the mip hierarchy and in the array of textures The texture view contains all the array texture elements from the specified mip level and array index
member.example:
Here is what the view covers with mipLevelIndex=1 and mrrayIndex=1
Array0 Array1 Array2 ______________________ Mip0 | | | | |------+------+------| Mip1 | | X | X | |------+------+------| Mip2 | | | | ----------------------
